turn.2: 1977–78 NHL season The 1977–78 NHL season was the 61st season of the National Hockey League.
turn.4: The Montreal Canadiens won their third Stanley Cup in a row, defeating the Boston Bruins four games to two in the Stanley Cup Finals.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: Clarence Campbell retired as NHL President, prior to this season.
turn.7: Who took over as NHL President?
turn.9: Did anything else happen in the 1977–78 season?
turn.10: A trophy for the top defensive forward, the Frank J. Selke Trophy, made its debut this season and went to Bob Gainey, who played left wing for Montreal.
turn.11: What teams were in the playoffs?
turn.12: On June 14, 1978, the league approved the merger of the financially struggling Cleveland Barons and Minnesota North Stars franchises, reducing the number of teams to 17, with the North Stars (now the Dallas Stars) assuming the Barons' place in the Adams Division.
